topicSummary: Urinary incontinence is defined as any involuntary leakage of urine. The main types are:Stress urinary incontinence.Urgency urinary incontinence.

topicHtmlObjects.htmlHeader: Incontinence - urinary, in women: Summary

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Update to drug interactions section for intravaginal oestrogen as per the manufacturer's Summary of Product Characteristics (SPC).

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Following post-market surveillance, severe hypertension, dizziness, constipation, diarrhoea, headache and dizziness have been added as adverse effects ABPI, 2016.Following a Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) Drug safety update severe uncontrolled hypertension has been added as a contraindication MHRA, 2015.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Nausea has been added as a common adverse effect of mirabegron following an update to the manufacturer's Summary of Product Characteristics (SPC) ABPI Medicines Compendium, 2015.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Angioedema has been added as a rare adverse effect of mirabegron following an update to the manufacturer's SPC ABPI Medicines Compendium, 2014d.

latestChanges.title: Reviewed
latestChanges.body: A literature search was conducted in October 2014 to identify evidence-based guidelines, UK policy, systematic reviews, and key RCTs published since the last revision of this topic. The following changes have been made to this topic:
